Posts.Content: KJC73 wrote: Hi, I am a newbie. I guess I am just looking for odds. I had a hysterectomy (left my ovaries) when I was 37 due to endometriosis and other B9 masses. After that, my OB suggested to start having annual mammograms. I'm now 40. I had my annual mammogram yesterday and was told I have a 1.4 cm spiculated mass. I'm going in for an ultrasound tomorrow morning. (I was surprised how quick they wanted me to come in. They were trying to find a way get me in today). I made a mistake searching Dr. Google because I didn't know what "spiculated" meant and am now freaking myself out. Is what I am reading correct. Like an 80-95% chance malignancy? Please don't sugar coat. I can totally handle it. The unknown and confusion is what is stirring my brain. Thank you. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Spiculated Mass KJC73 mustlovepoodles

Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2018 06:00PM - edited Aug 21, 2018 06:00PM by KJC73 Thank you Djmammo. That helps. No, I have no history of any breast surgery. Ill talk to them about a biopsy at my appt in the morning. Thank you again.
